All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Iterator<DocText>, TextContainer
public class XmlTextContainer
extends BaseTextContainer<XmlData>

Implementation of a text container for xml (or html) data.

Author:
Spence Koehler

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Get this text container's name.

close

public void close()
Close this container.

It is important that this method be called when finished iterating over the text (through hasNext and next) to properly release resources.

This method should typically be called in a finally block for the hasNext/next iteration.

Once this has been called, hasNext() will return false and next() will return null, but all other methods will retain their defined behavior.

isComplete

public boolean isComplete()
Determine whether the entire document has been visited through the iterator methods (next/hasNext).

Note that once the close method has been called, this value can never change from false to true.

convertToTextContainer

public TextContainer convertToTextContainer(DocText docText,
                                            boolean keepDocTexts)
Convert a docText from this container into another container.

This is used to be able to treat each docText from a container as high- level, iterable input in its own right if this makes sense for the docText.

Returns:
the docText as a container or null.

numNonEmptyPaths

public int numNonEmptyPaths(int startIndex,
